alert.note: Alert for Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:21PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bradley, northwestern Polk, southern McMinn and southwestern Monroe Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wildwood Lake, or 12 miles south of Cleveland, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Athens, Benton, Etowah, Charleston, South Cleveland, East Cleveland, Wildwood Lake, Englewood and Calhoun. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bradley; McMinn; Northwest Monroe; Southeast Monroe; West Polk
